question: Which type of cell is primarily responsible for transmitting electrical signals in the body?
short_explanation: Neurons transmit electrical impulses through synapses.
long_explanation: Neurons are specialized nerve cells responsible for communication between body systems. They conduct action potentials via axons and synapses using neurotransmitters.
applied_example: Understanding neuron function helps massage therapists recognize neurological symptoms referred from spinal or peripheral nerve irritation.
source_reference: Essential Cell Biology by Alberts et al.
text: Which type of cell is primarily responsible for transmitting electrical signals in the body?

question: Which type of cell is involved in contraction and movement of the body?
short_explanation: Myocytes are muscle cells responsible for contraction.
long_explanation: Myocytes contain contractile proteins actin and myosin. They are organized into cardiac, skeletal, and smooth muscle types, each with distinct functions.
applied_example: Tight or damaged myocytes contribute to muscle knots and dysfunction targeted during massage therapy.
source_reference: Human Anatomy & Physiology by Marieb & Hoehn
text: Which type of cell is involved in contraction and movement of the body?

question: Which cells produce antibodies in the immune system?
short_explanation: Plasma cells produce antibodies to target pathogens.
long_explanation: Derived from B lymphocytes, plasma cells are responsible for synthesizing and releasing immunoglobulins (antibodies) specific to antigens.
applied_example: A functioning immune response is critical for recovery from injury and preventing infection post-massage.
text: Which cells produce antibodies in the immune system?

question: Which type of connective tissue cell produces collagen and extracellular matrix?
short_explanation: Fibroblasts build the extracellular matrix in connective tissues.
long_explanation: Fibroblasts are responsible for producing collagen, elastin, and glycoproteins, crucial for tissue integrity, especially in fascia, tendons, and ligaments.
applied_example: Massage can influence fibroblast activity, promoting repair and reducing adhesions in fascia.
text: Which type of connective tissue cell produces collagen and extracellular matrix?

question: Which blood cell type primarily transports oxygen?
short_explanation: Red blood cells carry oxygen via hemoglobin.
long_explanation: Erythrocytes are specialized for oxygen and carbon dioxide transport. Their biconcave shape increases surface area for gas exchange.
applied_example: Improved circulation during massage can enhance oxygen delivery by red blood cells to tissues.
source_reference: Guyton and Hall Textbook of Medical Physiology
text: Which blood cell type primarily transports oxygen?

question: Which cell type lines internal organs and forms protective barriers?
short_explanation: Epithelial cells create surfaces and linings in the body.
long_explanation: Epithelial cells are involved in absorption, secretion, and protection. They line organs, blood vessels, and skin layers.
applied_example: Skin health impacts topical massage techniques; epithelial barriers may absorb oils and creams differently.
source_reference: Human Anatomy & Physiology by Marieb & Hoehn
text: Which cell type lines internal organs and forms protective barriers?

question: Which cell is responsible for breaking down bone tissue during remodeling?
short_explanation: Osteoclasts resorb bone by secreting acids and enzymes.
long_explanation: Osteoclasts are large multinucleated cells that dissolve bone matrix, balancing bone remodeling with osteoblasts.
applied_example: In conditions like osteoporosis, overactive osteoclasts weaken bones. Massage pressure may need adjustment for such clients.
text: Which cell is responsible for breaking down bone tissue during remodeling?

question: Which cell stores lipids and contributes to energy storage and insulation?
short_explanation: Adipocytes store fat and provide insulation.
long_explanation: Adipose tissue cells, called adipocytes, contain large lipid droplets that serve as energy reserves and protect against temperature extremes.
applied_example: Massage of adipose-rich areas may improve lymphatic drainage and circulation, supporting metabolism.
source_reference: Guyton and Hall Textbook of Medical Physiology
text: Which cell stores lipids and contributes to energy storage and insulation?

question: Which glial cell type forms the myelin sheath in the central nervous system?
short_explanation: Oligodendrocytes myelinate axons in the CNS.
long_explanation: Oligodendrocytes wrap around axons in the brain and spinal cord to form insulating myelin, improving signal conduction.
applied_example: Demyelinating diseases like MS impair CNS function. Neurological assessment before treatment is essential.
text: Which glial cell type forms the myelin sheath in the central nervous system?

question: Which cell type acts as a phagocyte in tissue and immune defense?
short_explanation: Macrophages engulf pathogens and cellular debris.
long_explanation: Macrophages are large immune cells derived from monocytes that ingest foreign material, playing a key role in inflammation and tissue repair.
applied_example: Massage can influence macrophage function by enhancing circulation and lymphatic flow, aiding recovery.
text: Which cell type acts as a phagocyte in tissue and immune defense?
